alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 2:17PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches in the valleys, 6 to 12 inches along highway 97 northeast of Interstate 5 up to Macdoel and 1 to 2 feet above 4000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over exposed mountains and gusting to 30 mph along Highway 97 northeast of Interstate 5. * WHERE...Western Siskiyou County above 2000 feet, including portions of highway 96, Sawyers Bar Road, all of Interstate 5, highways 3 and 96, and 89. * WHEN...From 1 AM Tuesday to 4 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could cause whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected between 10 PM Tuesday and 10 AM Wednesday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. Do not detour during winter storms. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: Central Siskiyou County; North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County; Western Siskiyou County
